CPU Idle Configuration

Files

file  pmlib_cpuidle.h
 This file declares the interface for CPU Idle functionality. This is is a low latency power saving mode which allows fast wakeup depending on the power mode set.
 
file  pmlib_cpuidle_pmmc.h
 This file declares the interface for PMMC CPU Idle functionality. This is a low latency power saving mode which allows fast wakeup depending on the power mode set.

Detailed Description

Dynamic power management of the CPUs involves setting the CPU power state to a lower power state when the CPU has nothing to do and then wake up from the low power state when the CPU has to resume its operations.

The CPU context is maintained every time the CPU goes to low power mode. Interrupts which are configured during the normal CPU operation can be configured as wakeup events which bring the CPU out of its low power state.

Some recommended power states for the different CPUs is as below:
- MPU : Subsystem Retention
- IPU : Subsystem Auto Clock Gate
- DSP : Subsystem Auto Clock Gate
- EVE : Subsystem Auto Clock Gate

Dynamic power management of the CPUs involves setting the CPU power state to a lower power state when the CPU has nothing to do and then wake up from the low power state when the CPU has to resume its operations.

The CPU context is maintained every time the CPU goes to low power mode. Interrupts which are configured during the normal CPU operation can be configured as wakeup events which bring the CPU out of its low power state.

Some recommended power states for the different CPUs is as below:
- MPU : Subsystem Retention
- DSP : Subsystem Retention

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum pmlibCpuIdleMode

PMLIB Cpu mode to be set.

Enumerator
PMLIB_IDLE_CPU_MODE_IDLE 

PMLIB index for CPU mode IDLE

PMLIB_IDLE_CPU_MODE_AUTOCG 

PMLIB index for CPU mode Auto clock gate mode

PMLIB_IDLE_CPU_MODE_OFF 

PMLIB index for CPU mode off

PMLIB_IDLE_CPU_MODE_MAX 

PMLIB index for CPU mode maximum

Function Documentation

void PMLIBCpu1ForcedOff ( void  )

Enter CPU1 into FORCE_OFF mode.

This function can be used by the application to enter CPU1 into FORCE_OFF mode when no binary is loaded for CPU1.

Returns
none
pmErrCode_t PMLIBCpuIdle ( pmhalPrcmPdState_t  pwrst)

Enter the CPU specified into the given low power state.

NOTE: To keep the ADAS power management simple, we only support one low-power mode per CPU. The power state is used in the API to enable supporting multiple low power states in future w/o breaking compatibility.

Parameters
pwrstLow power state to enter into. Refer enum pmhalPrcmPdState_t for details.
Returns
status Returns the status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS If the desired power state was met.
  • PM_FAIL If the desired power state was not met.
pmErrCode_t PMLIBCpuModePrepare ( pmhalPrcmModuleId_t  moduleId,
pmlibCpuIdleMode_t  mode 
)

Prepare the PRCM registers for the input CPU Idle mode.

Parameters
moduleIdModule which is to be prepared for CPU Idle Refer pmhalPrcmModuleId_t for the cpu module id
modeCPU mode to which the CPU is to be set. Refer pmlibCpuIdleMode_t for supported modes.
Returns
status Returns the status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS If the desired power state was configured.
  • PM_FAIL If the desired power state was not configured.
  • PM_BADARGS If the params passed are not valid
pmErrCode_t PMLIBPmmcCpuIdle ( void  )

Enter the CPU specified into the given low power state.

NOTE: To keep the ADAS power management simple, we only support one low-power mode per CPU. The power state is used in the API to enable supporting multiple low power states in future w/o breaking compatibility.

Returns
status Returns the status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS If the desired power state was met.
  • PM_FAIL If the desired power state was not met.
pmErrCode_t PMLIBPmmcCpuModeModify ( pmhalPmmcModuleId_t  moduleId,
uint32_t  mode 
)

CPU mode modifications via PMMC for idle mode entry and wakeup.

Parameters
moduleIdModule which is to be modified for CPU Idle/Wakeup Refer #pmhalPmmcModuleId_t for the cpu module id
modeCPU state to which the CPU is to be set. Refer to pmhal_ti_sci.h for supported modes.
Returns
status Returns the status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS If the desired power state was configured.
  • PM_FAIL If the desired power state was not configured.
void PMLIBSetCorepacPowerDown ( uint32_t  enable)

Configure the DSP Core Pac Off mode when the DSP CPU executes Idle. Applicable only to DSP.

Parameters
enable- 1 to configure the DSP PWRCMD register to put the DSP Core Pac to off state when the DSP executes Idle Instruction.
  • 0 to configure the DSP PWRCMD register to not put the DSP CorePac to off state when the DSP executes Idle Instruction.
Returns
none
